data.text: Need Travel Insurance to Enter Egypt

Hi guys, how do you do with your travel insurance? I was looking for 3 months in the Middle East. It was for nearly 1,000 EUR. That is way to much. Unfortunately I can't enter e.g. Egypt without one. - I am Swedish and living in Sweden. The little cheaper ones I only found for UK and US citizen or they didn't have insurance for 70+.
Its problematic..things skyrocketed during the pandemic.
data.author: Craig Martin

data.text: Try Seven Corners for a quote
data.author: Craig Martin

data.text: Thank you for sharing this!
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: another idea, for example look into a hiking or biking association which offers coverage. get worldwide coverage if they offer it. It may only cover biking or hiking but will they check at border? when i went to Egypt they never asked for anything but that was pre covid.
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: Good to know thanks!
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: in Spain the mtn clubs offer worldwide coverage for hiking but you can add biking, skiing, it only covers those activities but you get a card and policy. it may work. I'd imagine in Sweden you could get coverage easily and cheaply
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: I don't know such clubs offering insurance here, but I'll google it.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: are you entering Egypt by air or land?
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: Travel insurance has three components - medical, cancellation and interruption. You absolutely need medical. Cancellation is for things like illness that cause you to cancel before getting on the plane - it’s expensive and I never buy it, instead paying as close to departure as possible and rolling the dice. Interruption is for losses due to the trip being delayed, rescheduled or cancelled after your departure date. It’s cheap and I usually take it because the problems I’ve had on trips have always occurred during the trip, not prior to. These three are often sold as a package, but look at the components - you may not need all three, and the cancellation bit is pricey
data.author: Karen Robyn

data.text: Thanks, I know that and I am looking for only the medical part, because by cycling I don't need the others. Anyway, it is hard to find just the medical part only.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: ah, you just said travel insurance… good luck!
data.author: Karen Robyn

https://safetywing.com/nomad-insurance Try these guys, they're one of the cheapest
SafetyWing - Insurance for Nomads, by Nomads
safetywing.com
data.author: Paul Underwood

data.text: Thanks, I have seen that, but they only insure until 69 years of age. I will be 72 this year.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: Ah, I don't understand why they stop insuring people after a certain age. Doesn't make sense.
data.author: Paul Underwood

data.text: Not me either and also it is more expensive past 65 years of age. They don't ask, how healthy one is.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: I go without.
data.author: Richard Brass

data.text: I did before, but Egypt asks for insurance to be allowed to enter
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: look into buying a policy with a grace period. Buy it, print it out, cancel it. You usually have a week to cancel. remember though if you don't have insurance and you need it you'll be screwed.
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: i spent thousands of dollars in insurance to travel the world. i used it for little things, nothing major, but im glad i had it. I never had to worry.
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: Unfortunately I only have my pension and I also have to pay my rent. I settled 3 years ago, coming back from working abroad. It is hard to get apartments here especially with afordable rent. Though I have to find a cheap solution.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: I know, i was in the same exact boat. i had insurance at home, i bought a geoblue policy, about $110 a month, $1 million in coverage including preexisting conditions because i had coverage at home. without it preexisting wouldn't be covered. they had preferred doctors around the world so i didn't have to pay anything up front. I spent a lot but it was worth it. i also rented my place out to someone while i was gone that helped
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: Thanks, I live in a house, where only people 60+ are allowed to rent. It isn't easy to find a 60+ person looking for a 2hand contract - specially not in this small town, where I live. It would be different in Stockholm, but I couldn't find an apartment there.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: you could just show up at the border, would you be entering from Israel? worst case if they check you just don't go. Israel and Jordan are nice for biking. Of course Egypt would be great too
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: I'll go to Egypt for COP27 (as a low profile activist). It depends on the situation in Syria, when I will enter Turkey. I would prefer going overland, but taking a ferry from Turkey to Port Said is the other option. I am also afraid, that all the countries in the Middle East are asking for a travel = medical insurance. I am still planning.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: best would be to buy a policy then cancel it if you want to enter a country which requires it but can't afford it. It subjects you to risks though. I've never done it. keep looking, you may find something
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text:
try this https://www.globelink.eu/wizard#/step2.html

data.text: Thanks, but it isn't possible yet for start in July. I'll try it later, if I don't find anything else, which works

data.text: i tried it, a 3 month trip 10 million euro health worldwide policy for a 70 yest old Swede from July to Septis 338 euros. it sounds good and at least you have the policy in hand.

Ivan Gorodess

data.text: I tried it as well, but I couldn't even come so far. It might have to do with, from which country one try it. Anyway, I need it from mid October.

data.text: it works for me through 2022. its a bit tricky clicking on the arrow to advance the months. Good luck.

data.text: I can't open your pics, I only get black sites

data.text: still the same
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: I got it to work now, thanks. Btw I tried to find out what the insurance would cost for an entire year, but for my age they only offer up to 6 month. I feel discriminated.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: will you still be in those countries after 6 months? There is probably another company out there that offers similar benefits you could switch to. If you fly home you can purchase another policy, in case that was in your plans. At least you have six months of coverage, a very good start.
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: I'll try to compare the costs for the entire trip (estimated for a year) and the time in the Middle East (about three month). I won't fly! I even tried to go overland all the way and avoid ferries. Unfortunately Russia started the war against Ukraine.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: I was just in Poland and Ukraine volunteering at the border. It will not be over anytime soon.
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: I was there also working with WCK. Until I got Covid and very sick. Had to isolate myself to protect others. I’ve had three shots. As sick as I was I believe the outcome would have been bad without vaccines. The one thing that stayed good was my oxygen. Politically the problem seems to be everywhere. The rise of strong man nationalist. It’s quite alarming.
data.author: Richard Brass

data.text: WCK is doing an incredible job, they're making a difference. Were you at Medyka? I agree about the right and i think it's only a matter of time till this conflict widens. 2022 will not be a good year for the world
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: nobody was wearing masks there . in my hostel 2 people were very sick w covid symptoms, they never returned to hostel but it wasn't covid. In Ukraine i never saw a mask. i am thankful i was vaccinated and never got it . on the Ryanair flight back many people weren't wearing masks, the flight attendants did nothing
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: We don't wear masks in Sweden either. Not even my GP.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: im in Spain, its mandatory indoors and on public transport. Many people still wear them in the street. i don't it's interesting how people in different countries react to the same thing For instance, many people won't wait for a red light to cross the street in the US. In Spain most people will wait even if there is no car in sight.
data.author: Ivan Gorodess

data.text: In Sweden we do like in Spain about the red lights, in Germany it's like in the US.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: I use￼ World Nomad. I think for three months it cost me about $350. I once lost everything in a flood in Vietnam. I ended up getting about $5000 for all my stuff basically everything that I was able to provide proof of purchase.
data.author: Daniel Jack Frost

data.text: Thanks, I used World Nomad in 2016, but now I am too old for it.
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text: Dr Walter - 6 months less than 500 euro.
data.author: Shell Griffo

data.text: Is Dr Walter an insurance agency?
data.author: Dorothee Hildebrandt

data.text:
Yep - they were the only ones who would insure me because I was not leaving from my home country. During my trip I've actually had to use the insurance for medical expenses (surgery) - they paid up. World Nomads would not cover an Australian at in December - not sure what the case is now. https://www.dr-walter.com/en/
Start: DR-WALTER
dr-walter.com
